Create Parallel Coordinates Plot for GM Clusters

Source: R/gm_visualization.R
create_parallel_plot_gm.Rd

Creates a parallel coordinates plot showing cluster profiles (means, variance, or discrimination ratios).

Usage

create_parallel_plot_gm(
  analysis_data,
  what = "means",
  cutoff = 0.3,
  orientation = "horizontal",
  variable_order = "variance",
  top_k = Inf,
  centering = "none",
  title = NULL
)

Arguments

analysis_data

Standardized GM analysis data

what

Character: "means" (cluster means, default), "variances" (within-cluster SDs), or "ratio" (between/within variance ratio for discrimination)

cutoff

Threshold for highlighting

orientation

Character: "horizontal" (variables on x-axis, default) or "vertical" (variables on y-axis)

variable_order

Character: "variance" (default) orders by variance descending, "variance_reversed" by variance ascending, "mean" orders by mean value ascending, "mean_reversed" by mean descending, "original" preserves data order, "original_reversed" reverses data order, "alphabetical" sorts alphabetically, "alphabetical_reversed" reverse alphabetical

top_k

Integer: maximum number of variables to display (default: Inf, shows all). If there are more variables, only the top k most variable features are shown.

centering

Character: "none" (default), "variable" (center by row mean), or "global" (center by grand mean). Only applies when what="means".

title

Plot title (optional)

Value

ggplot2 object
